intro: Byttneria morii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and dense, glossy green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing flat, seed-like structures. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
